security_audit.summary: All 34 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. This is a pure prompt-based documentation skill containing only behavioral guidelines. The static scanner incorrectly flagged metadata hash strings (content_hash, tree_hash), source repository URLs, and English words like 'hash', 'system', and 'compare' as security threats. No executable code, network calls, filesystem operations, or external commands exist. The skill-report.json already correctly classified this as risk_level: safe.

content.value_statement: Users often need accurate, neutral descriptions without recommendations or next steps. This skill delivers structured analysis focusing on facts and observations. It helps produce clear, factual descriptions of text, data, events, or systems.
actual_capabilities: Produce neutral descriptions of text, data, events, or systems
Analyze and compare information with clear structure
Extract and report facts with evidence references
Summarize complex topics in organized sections
Identify trends, constraints, and open questions
limitations: Does not provide recommendations or prescribe actions
Does not create plans or strategies
Cannot answer what should I do type questions
Limited to descriptive analysis within stated scope

use_cases.title: Analyze Study Findings
use_cases.description: Summarize research data and extract key facts from complex documents

use_cases.title: Explain Code Systems
use_cases.description: Describe code architecture and compare implementation approaches objectively

use_cases.title: Document Features
use_cases.description: Report system status and document technical concepts with structured format

prompt_templates.title: Simple Description
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe [topic] focusing on key characteristics and how it works.

prompt_templates.title: Comparative Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze and compare [option A] versus [option B] on key criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a structured summary of the following data including background, findings, and trends.

prompt_templates.title: Fact Extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract the main facts and evidence from this document and identify any knowledge gaps.

output_examples.input: Describe the main components of a REST API and how they interact
output: REST API uses HTTP methods like GET, POST, PUT, DELETE for resource operations
Resources are identified by URLs and represented in formats like JSON
Stateless communication means each request contains all needed information
Response codes indicate operation success or failure such as 200, 201, 400, 404, 500

output_examples.input: Compare Python and JavaScript for backend development
output: Python offers simpler syntax and larger ecosystem for data science and AI integration
JavaScript provides unified language stack for frontend and backend with Node.js
Python typically has better readability and faster development for data processing
JavaScript excels in real-time applications and WebSocket-based systems

output_examples.input: Summarize the key findings from this research data
output: Background: Study examined performance metrics across 500 participants over 6 months
Key findings show 23 percent improvement in target areas with consistent methods
Trends indicate strongest gains in the first quarter with diminishing returns thereafter
Constraints include limited demographic diversity and self-reported measurement

best_practices: State scope and constraints upfront to focus the analysis
Request evidence and sources to support factual claims
Separate verified facts from reasonable inferences clearly
anti_patterns: Asking for recommendations when you need only facts
Using vague prompts without clear subject or scope
Mixing descriptive requests with prescriptive questions

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code platforms.

faq.question: What are the input size limits?
faq.answer: The skill handles text, data, and artifacts within standard AI context limits.

faq.question: How does it integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Use it after data collection skills to analyze results without prescribing actions.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains only prompt guidelines and makes no external calls.

faq.question: Why is output structured?
faq.answer: Structured format ensures clarity, consistency, and easy parsing of descriptive content.

faq.question: How is this different from prescriptive skills?
faq.answer: Descriptive skills analyze and report facts. Prescriptive skills recommend actions.
